description:
Works:
Prune Lime (ID 1) located in the front garden according to the following specifications: remove low epicormic shoots to a height of 4-5 metres to improve clearance over drive. thin crown to remove approx 25% of live branches to reduce branch density. Most thinning custs will be between 2 and 3 centimetres in diameter. Reduce lateral branches by approximatedly 203 metres to provide clearance to elevation. Prune Bay Tree (ID 2) located at the rear left boundary according to the following specifications : Reduce crown height by approx 2-3 metres to balance and lightly trim sides to a formal shape. Prune Mulberry (ID 3) located atthe rear left boundary according to the following specificatios: Reduce regrowth by approx 2-3 metres to redeuce risk of branch, stem failure. Dead branches should be shortened or if necessary removed if they pose an unacceptable risk to people or property. Prune Weeping Willow (ID 4) located at the rear boundary with 18 according to the following specification: (this has been agreed with the neighbours Mr and Mrs James Poole who have also submitted an application for tree works) Reduce lateral branch growing through bay tree by approximately 4-5 metres to provide clearance to adjacent tree. Remove resulting debris and dead branches should be shortened or if necessary removed if they pose an unacceptable risk to people or property. Prune Judas Tree (ID 5) located at the rear right corner according to the following specifications: Clean to remove all dead, diseased and broken branches 2 centimetres in diameter and larger throughout crown to improve health and appearance and reduce risk of branch failure.
